newsitem.title: GERMANY: Kinkel says time to stop "quacking on" about euro.
newsitem.headline: Kinkel says time to stop "quacking on" about euro.

text.p: German Foreign Minister Klaus Kinkel said it was time for German politicians who have raised doubts about the single European currency to "stop quacking on about the euro".

In an interview with Die Zeit weekly newspaper, Kinkel said Bavarian premier Edmund Stoiber's warnings about the need to fulfil strict deficit criteria before the economic and monetary union (EMU) can be launched were due to local elections.

"Bavaria is a field unto itself," Kinkel said. "There are state elections there next year and the Bavarian Christian Social Union (CSU) is the only party that doesn't have to campaign on a national basis."
Kinkel said it was advisable to everyone including Stoiber to "weigh very carefully the words of those who carry responsibility in Germany".
"We have to stop quacking on about the euro," Kinkel said."
